issue.title: [Feature Idea] Register templates from strings, rust-embed, or equivalent
issue.body:
This feature would be required to allow strings embedded in the program (specifically like in https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/issues/227) to be used as templates.
Currently rocket_contrib::Template only supports templates which exist on the real file system.

This feature could exist outside of rocket, by just using the template engine directly and passing in the template string and context.  However, this feature may still make sense in `rocket_contrib` to remove boilerplate from the common desire to embed static files in the executable.

This feature may also be solved by or related to implementing https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/issues/64.

Issue was labelled as idea instead of request, mostly because I'm looking for input and less certain about what shape the ideal solution will be in.

body:
I'm feeling this limitation too.

I think an acceptable resolution would be to just make `rocket_contrib::templates::Context` public. Then users could write their own fairing, which could modify e.g. `Tera` through `context.engines.tera` after calling `Context::initialize`, and then add the `Context` to `Rocket` state.

`Context` doesn't seem to contain any information that *must* be kept private. It's not ideal to make users set the templates directory manually (as in my scenario above), but is not that difficult, and that part of `Template::fairing` could be abstracted out into a `Template::root` function.

issue.title: Allow access to template containers
issue.body:
and make it possible to interact with them before adding them to managed state.

Also reexports `tera` and `handlebars`.

See #64.

issue.title: Allow registration of template helpers / filters
issue.body:
Handlebars allows the registration of helpers and Tera the registration of filters, which allow custom functions to be included in templates.

See PR #60 for some initial discussion.

issue.title: Provide a template registration callback

labels.name: pr: closed
labels.description: This pull request was not merged

body: I've submitted a new PR if anyone wants to try it out: #500.

issue.title: Provide template registration callback for native template engine features

labels.name: pr: merged
labels.description: This pull request was merged manually.

issue.body:
Closes #64. Supersedes #431, #500.

This includes most of the commits from #431 and is based on further feedback on #431 and #500, in particular changing the signature of `Template::show`. I considered including #500 instead and still can if that is desired, but #431 already added to the tests for handlebars

issue.title: Template helpers

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
Hi,
I'm currently trying to use handlebars templates in a rocket project.
The rust crate for handlebars that is used in the `rocket_contrib` crate allows for the registration of so-called helper-functions that one can call from the template code itself, for example to compare strings or to insert the current date and time.
As far as I can see, there's no way to currently do add one through the existing fairing code, since
I can't get access to the underlying `Context`-element that contains the engine through the managed state, because it's not publically exported (at least not in version 0.3.16).
I'm not sure what the best way to approach this would be.
Since helper functions exist in Tera templates as well, maybe the necessary infrastructure could be shared?
